BOB ANDERS.raw_line: Carnival's bigger today. MARK LIJEK, 29, a consular officer, joins Anders at the window.Are these supposed to be bulletproof?Can we get some fucking police please?Iranians first. Go! Now!Keep going.Mmm. 50, 35.-- it was thirty seconds for Christ's sake. To get some air in the yard. I couldn't breathe --Who saw me go out?Miss Hall Monitor. Creeping around with her notebook --It's theater of the absurd.What was the objection to picking normal cover identities?We can't stand up to that. We don't know what the hell movie people do.I saw it in Burma. They get people out. They know how.They suspect something?What's the alternative? This is the ball game, J. What world are you living in?Who was it? Pat shakes her head.Robert Baker, director.Yes.I'm sorry?No.Toronto.Scorched earth policy tonight. Nothing gets left. Taylor comes in, drink in hand, thoughts heavy, looks at Tony.Or Canada?Two days ago.We were looking at locations to make a film. I'm the director. Immigration Officer pauses and looks up. Looks at the six other faces. He looks every bit as confrontational as Tony acted in rehearsal.

MARK LIJEK.raw_line: Well, they've never been tested.Nobody is coming. We need to go.Same thing. The sound of a fork on a glass. Ken Taylor is standing up.-- fifty-seven -- fifty-eight -- Mark counts out as Lee Schatz ds push-ups. Bob Anders watches a television in the b.g., subtitled in Farsi.A hundred and twelve --And we have a new champion. Bob Anders looks up from Khomeini, who keeps talking in the b.g., and applauds.What are the chances?What's the number value of good'? 30 percent chance of success? 80 percent?His opinion got us out of the embassy in the first place.He told them there were six of us. They're expecting six.Not that picture. You won't want to scare them. A nervous smile. Trying to deal with anxiety. J and Kathy Stafford look to each other. Sitting reading newspapers while the other Houseguests prep for the scout. The PHONE starts ringing.Timothy Harris, location manager.A film. Mark mimes turning the rotor of a movie camera. Komiteh #1 dsn't understand.

J STAFFORD.raw_line: -- We're not going out in this --Kathy dsn't want to go down again.You've washed them three times. He puts his arm on her shoulder. She keeps scrubbing.... every day they catch another friend of the shah at the airport. Kangaroo trials then firing squads. Just for having American names in their phone books. He puts the Iranian newspaper in front of Mendez.You've been here an hour and you're asking us to trust you with our lives, Mr. --Is that your real name? A beat.I'm serious, too. This is what?Snitches in banana republics. They get them over the border after the coup...-- even if they do. They find us here, we're not lying, we're just hiding. We go out there with fake passports, we're spies, period, execution.That man out there, he's got bad cards, he's gonna lose. If he loses, it's our lives.We are a nation of 35 million and... many of these people are looking forward to martyrdom. Kathy Stafford looks into the room. J stops talking, looks up.She pleaded with me. Mark, looking to J. This is new.When it started in the streets nine months ago. She begged for us to leave. She packed our bags. I said, A little longer.' And what I was thinking was, This is a good thing for me. Stay. Show Newsom you've got the balls. Grab for the ring.'We won't do it.I don't trust you.The one where they're hanging people from construction cranes, Bob. J takes Kathy's hand and gs, leaving Mendez with the others. After a moment --I wish I could believe you, Mr. Harkins.Sean Bissett, associate producer.Producer.Uh... High and Dry.(nearly defeated,they go like this... whoooosh, hmm? They can fly... The people are just farmers, but they rise up and find their courage and defeat the alien king-- Mendez watches. It's a performance. The three young Komiteh are now wide-eyed, pointing, whispering in Farsi, like teenagers around a comic book. Azizi says something to another Komiteh in the room.

MENDEZ.raw_line: Yeah. He listens for a moment, then sits up, suddenly wide- awake.Ten weeks State's sitting on this?Compromised?White House?Who else knows?Jesus Christ.Who's handling? They walk through a door and out of the Pit.They don't do exfils.Then why's he want me?You can send in training wheels and wait at the border with Gatorade. Attention turns to Mendez. O'Donnell shifts. Engell, not happy.It's 300 miles to the Turkish crossings. They'd need a support crew behind them with a tire pump.They get caught with journalist creds, you've got Peter Jennings with a noose around his neck in an hour. PAUL LAMONT, late 20s, a Master's from the Woodrow Wilson School before he joined CIA --The school was shut eight months ago. Bates, meanwhile, removing a binder from his accordion folder: in the binder, a photograph of an emaciated kid in Namibia.What do you see in the picture, sir? A beat. Pender dsn't like this, but he'll play.What's on the ground?So what crops are the do-gooders inspecting under Frosty? Pender shifts.Exfils are like abortions. You don't wanna need one, but when you do, you don't do it yourself. The meeting is breaking up. Pender, followed by Bates, leaves the room. Engell, who has just been made to look bad and inherited a problem, stops by Tony.Buddy-man.You do homework tonight?What was it? But Tony can hear a television soundtrack with ominous electronic music.What do I hear?What channel?Catch me up. Tony listens, staring ahead at the TV . A desert landscape dotted with technological garbage. An ape played by Roddy MacDowell walks across the landscape. He's staring at the television, but now really paying attention. The apes walk into the ruins of what was once a great city. RODDY MacDOWELL This is the hell my forefathers used to speak about.Hi. Sorry. Hi.They're a Canadian film crew on a location scout for a science fiction movie -- A shift in the room.Star Wars, Star Trek. They need an exotic place to shoot. We put it out -- the Canadian producers put it out -- that they're looking at Turkey, Egypt, whatever. Then we go to the consulate and say we wanna look at Iran. I fly in there and we fly out together as a film crew. Done.This is more plausible than foreigners who want to go to school in Iran --I've got a contact in L.A.What are you shooting?Any good?Who's the target audience?It's an exfil.Worst place you can think of.Six got away. They're hiding in the city. I'm going over to get them.I need you to help me make a fake movie.I need to set up a production company and build a cover around making a movie.No.That's right.No.Can you teach a guy how to be a director in a day?I'm the producer.... and past a hundred Komiteh at the airport.That's too soon.Fade in on starship landing. An exotic, Middle Eastern vibe. Women gather, offering ecstatic libations to the sky gods.'It's a space movie in the Middle East. Ds it matter? Chambers looks at the BULLSEYE logo on the cover page. Reacts.Why do we need the option?Is it the wrong day?One month.Kevin Harkins. Studio Six Films.You know Warren Beatty?You got kids, Lester?You see them much?Why's that?A son. Lives with his mother in Virginia.Taking time off. He's gotta... stay where he is.War' sounds like Star Wars. Let's use a different word. Mendez closes the door to his private office.I need another week.We've got a script. We've got business cards.We've got a poster. If I'm them? It's nothing we couldn't make at home.Biggest Canadian production in history.' Canadian Gone With TheAre you turning people away?Any way to make the chariots look more -- Middle-Eastern -- ?Iran. Kirby takes out a marker and starts to sketch a futuristic-looking desert glider.Tehran.Why'd he do it?It's a death sentence, Jack.How'd you always get around the pricks upstairs?I used your name. Jack looks to Tony.You can forget about that time- share in Ocean City, Jack.Yes, sir.Yes, sir.-- two, we think everybody knows Hollywood people. And everybody thinks they would shoot during Stalingrad with Pol Pot directing if it'd sell tickets.Barely claim me as it is.Just Christine. They don't need to look at one another. A shared understanding.Guess I should have brought some books to read in prison.We've got a green light. Chambers gives Siegel a thumbs-up.Keep the office running till you hear otherwise. (this means thankBusiness. Film production. The Consul Official looks at his Canadian passport.My boss waited until I was here to send the telex.Can't be right all the time.When'd you get back?Were you metal detecting?But you kept busy.So if they look, they'll know six people didn't come in with me.How's June?I'm sorry.Good. Yeah.Six more are joining me today. They're coming from Canada.The bazaar, maybe the palace.Mr. Ambassador.You're thinking of FBI, sir. They get into the car.I'll take care of that.A day to prep them with their cover stories. Two if they need it.The chances are good.There are no Canadians in the country for normal reasons.That's why I'm here. I'll be with you. This is what I do.This would be a first.Harkins.No.If we go, you need to leave immediately. There's aI don't know.Your cover identities were created specifically for each one of you. Mendez, now dressed to leave, is handing each Houseguest an envelope.What I need you to do is memorize everything inside. Who you are, what you are, where you've been. Cora Lijek looks at a document from inside her envelope. A union card for the Canadian Writers Guild with her picture on it.When we're done, you'll know these so well that you'll dream as these people. Mendez nods at them, and gs. The Houseguests look at what's inside their envelopes -- all except J Stafford, whose envelope remains sealed.The Minister of Culture and Guidance has approved your location scout.'He will send a representative to meet you and your crew at the Khayyam entrance to the Grand Bazaar tomorrow at 3 PM.'Or maybe they're cooperating.Seven Canadians, Jack.They're getting there.What I know is we need to act like a movie crew. We go to the bazaar today, we fly out tomorrow. Silent assent among the group. Then J Stafford, sitting with his wife, speaks up --I'm asking you to trust me.This one, how much? One day, how much?I promise you that if you will play along today, I will get you out tomorrow.My name is Tony Mendez. Mendez gs back out to the minivan. STAY WITH J and Kathy.Tell me who you are. This recalls attention from the windows.Let's make a movie.If I said you were looking through the wrong end of that viewfinder, would I be right? Lee turns the viewfinder around and looks through it again.She's the production designer. Her job is to take photographs. SHOPKEEPER getting more and more heated in Farsi.Nobody broke. At the door to the residence, Tony can see Pat Taylor, holding Sahar's hand, both looking spooked as the Houseguests come inside.Tomorrow they'll be ready. We start to hear the sound of the evening's call to prayer, amplified over a megaphone, in the distance.Where was your passport issued? Bob Anders dsn't know. ANGLES ON the Houseguests.Where were you born?Toronno like piranha. Canadians don't pronounce the T.If you're held for questioning, they'll bring in somebody who knows that.Last three Canadian prime minsters.Good. Your job on the film.Associate Producer. What's the name of the last film you worked on?Who paid for the movie?What's your middle name? J Stafford is silent. He looks down to consult the paper in front of him, but before he can, Mendez pulls the paper.He's an American spy. Shoot him. A beat on Stafford, frustrated --They'll try to break you by getting you agitated. You need to know your rÃ©sumÃ© so well that you don't flinch.My story's the only thing between you and the gun to your head. A beat. Mendez puts the rÃ©sumÃ© back in front of Stafford. Kathy looks at her husband: he just isn't good at this.Let's go again.What is it?I never would have exposed them if I wasn't authorized to take them out.They will be taken. Probably notWe're responsible for those people.I think the most important thing you can do to be ready for tomorrow is rest.So you know.Somebody is responsible for things when things happen, Jack. I am responsible.Good. And you two leave right now. Ken Taylor nods. Mendez shakes his hand.The first checkpoint is just to look at your passport.Your passports came straight from the Canadians, so you're gonna be fine.The second checkpoint --The second is immigration. You'll hand them these. They say you landed two days ago.These guys are bureaucrats left over from the shah. They can't be bothered to second-guess you.Third checkpoint is the trap.It's manned by Revolutionaries. Most of them were educated in the U.S. or Europe.They know how many T's are in Toronto.You can call our office. Mendez hands Azizi his card. STUDIO SIX FILMS. Kevin Harkins. A 213 phone number.Wha'd you say to her?He wants to fire me himself.If they push it a week, I can bring Ian. That's his winter break.They're gonna hand me an award, then they're gonna take it back?I thought we did. O'Donnell claps Tony on the shoulder. Tony walks towards the entrance and Jack heads to his car.Hi.

O'DONNELL.raw_line: The six of them went out a back exit. Brits turned them away, Kiwis turned them away. The Canadians took them in. They've been there since. O'Donnell hands Mendez pages with STAFF PHOTOGRAPHS of SIX PEOPLE -- the escaped embassy employees -- as he continues to toss stuff into his folder.Traffic calls them The Houseguests. Haven't left the Canadian ambassador's house since it happened.Just a matter of time. We've got Revolutionary Guards going door-to- door like Jehovah's Witnesses, looking for escapees. They're out for blood, Tony. Half of them think Khomeini's been too lenient with the ones in the embassy. Walking out of his office, Mendez following.Carter's shitting enough bricks to build the pyramids. He wants the six of them out.Just the families. Meanwhile, some genius in the embassy was keeping a mug book of everybody who worked there.We think it got shredded before they got in, but the fuckers have sweat-shop kids in there re- assembling the shreds.They're gonna make an example of the ones who escaped. Standing- room-only for beheadings in the square.State's coordinating in-house.They do now. They want to run it by us, strictly as consultants. Off his look.Engell's saying it's lose-lose. These people die, they die badly. Publicly. State wants the blame, he'll give it to them.So he can tell State he ran it by his best exfil guy. They stop in front of a conference room. Jack looks at him.Tony. This isn't the kind of meeting where you talk.Tony's an exfil spesh. He got a lot of the shah's people out after the fall.Is he coming? Engell nods for the door to be shut.Have a seat, Tony. He dsn't. There's an energy in him we haven't seen before.We want you to go to L.A. If you can make the movie thing credible, we'll take it to the Director. (a beat; a cigaretteThe Canadians are done. Say they're bearing too much risk.Foreign Secretary cornered Vance in Brussels and told him she's serving eviction papers. The Cardinal wants all cover options on his desk Friday morning.Engell's prepping the Bikes Option and the Teachers Option. You've got 72 hours to make yours better...They caught the shah's chief of security trying to get on a plane to Paris.Since the incident, the number of guards at the airport has doubled. Thorough background examinations should be expected.'You don't have it.He did it cause he did it.He saw a covert intelligence officer saying cheese' with R2- D2. They're going with the teachers.Well then it's on Engell.What did you do to get the meeting?Brace yourself. It's like talking to those two old fucks on The Muppets.' Vance and Turner enter the room without recognizing them. Mendez and O'Donnell stand up.One, there are no foreign teachers in Iran anymore --This is the best bad idea we have, sir. By far. Vance and Turner exchange looks.I'm required to remind you that if you're detained, the agency will not claim you.Your In Case Of's' good?Nah. They'll kill you long before prison. Tony gets out of the car, pulls his bags from the back seat, and slams the door. Headed into the airport.He got to the embassy. O'Donnell closes the door. Pender, wearing an undone tuxedo, as if he's just been pulled from a formal event. They stay standing.I can't tell you more than that cause I don't know any more.Mother of God.They called your bluff.N.E. says absolutely not. Seven Americans walking the bazaar, you're asking for a riot, it's theNever give them multiple shots at a cover. Are they even ready?Terrific. There's no prize for Most Improved.'Go to black on green. Jack's calling him here, so he knows something's wrong.Go to black on green. Mendez turns knobs on the satellite phone.It all just changed. They called the game. You've got to come back. ON Mendez, not believing what he's hearing.Joint Chiefs are planning a military rescue of the hostages in a month. Delta Force started training to storm the grounds. So if the six of them get brought down there, they won't be held for long.It's over, Tony.LISTEN TO ME. The thinking's changed. Six Americans get pulled out of a Canadian diplomat's house and executed, it's another world outrage. Six Americans get caught playing movie make-believe with the CIA at the airport and executed, it's a national embarrassment. They're calling the operation.Yeah.We need to confirm those seven tickets out of Tehran onI'm saying it's back on!What the fuck ds that mean?Where's Engell?Pull him out.It is going.Am I goddamn close?Where's the Director?Find White House Chief of Staff.We're a fucking SPY AGENCY! FINDWhere are his kids?Where do his kids go to school?Yes, it's Mr. Murphy calling from Pace Academy for Mr. Jordan... I'm afraid it IS an emergency...Jack O'Donnell from C.I.Tehran Houseguest operation is ready NOW. We don't have the President's go-ahead. They are going to be captured. Jordan stands up with the phone.Copy D.S.! Confirm the tickets!Get the L.A. office -- tell them to be ready in case they call.They should have boarded already.Wait.Involved in what? We're as surprised as anybody. Thank you, Canada. Jack raises a glass of Scotch and takes a drink.And I left my autograph book at home. His Eminence called me. He wants to see you.He wants to give you the Intelligence Star. You're getting the highest award of merit of the Clandestine Services of these United States. Ceremony's two weeks from today. Mendez stops walking. A beat.The op was classified so the ceremony's classified. He can't know about it. Nobody can know about it.If we wanted applause, we would have joined the circus.(yelling to Tony; anHe didn't say.

TAYLOR.raw_line: -- Martin was the worst one. Martin the Maximo King --I read today that Tehran was voted the second most desirable city in the world to live in. Everywhere else tied for first.You should get into the crawl space.You're getting a visitor.Ken Taylor. He shakes Tony's hand and they start to walk to Taylor's car.I was expecting more of a G-Man look.These are blank, y'know. The stamps?How long?And you'll fly out with them? Tony nods. A distant sound of a crowd outside.There's something you should know. We think one of our housekeepers figured out who they are. We don't know if we can trust her. Now the noise outside is louder. Taylor turns to the window. Tony joins him.So sooner is better. They stand listening to the demonstration sounds, echoing over the rooftops of the city.We've got orders to close the embassy and go back. There's nowhere for them to stay.Pat and I discussed it. If they catch you at the airport, they come here and we go on trial for harboring the enemy. It's a risk we took. Can you pull this off?They drew you out there to take your picture.Kevin.If we tell them, they'll panic. It's better if you just don't show.It was always a fucked mission. You came closer than anybody else. Kathy and Cora are cracking each other up. No one sees Mendez take a bottle of Macallan from the table and put it in his bag.(to Gauthier, as he

CHAMBERS.raw_line: If he could act he wouldn't be playing the Minotaur. He smiles and waves at the Minotaur and begins to work on his prosthetic with a brush and solvent.Hey, Tony.A monster movie.The target audience will hate it.People with eyes. Talk to me.From where?Universal City.How you getting in the embassy?What am I making?You've come to the right place.That we're not going to make.You want to go around Hollywood acting like you're an important person in the movie business.But you don't want to actually do anything.You'll fit right in.This one's got an M.A. in English. She should be your screenwriter. Sometimes they go on scouts cause they want the free meals. This guy's the director.You can teach a rhesus monkey to be a director in a day. Look, if you're gonna do it, you've got to do it. The Khomaniacs are fruit loops, but they have cousins selling eight tracks and prayer rugs on La Brea. You can't build cover stories around a movie that dsn't exist. You need a script. You need a producer.No, you're not. Associate' at best. If it's a twenty-million dollar Star Wars rip-off, you need somebody who's a somebody to put his name on it. Here we see some AUTOGRAPHED 70s CELEBRITY 8X10s hanging on the wall. The waiter brings a bill.Somebody respectable. With credits. Who we can trust with classified information. Who'll produce a fake movie. For free.Mazel tov, Lester.(to Lester, as heYou ever think, Lester, how it's all for the cameras?It's ancient Troy.Yeah, Kenny, please. It's John Chambers, about the office space.I did a movie with Rock Hudson once.You know her?Crane down over the battlefield and hold there...'Argo fuck yourself. They raise to that.(picking up theArgo fuck yourself.It's off. They want us to pack up the office. A beat on Lester. Very respectful.But see -- it worries me, what you said, and I'll tell you why. So. Lester takes some documents out of a folder.The way this looks to me -- through the cataracts, I grant you -- is that you can either sign here and take ten thousand for your toilet-paper script -- or you can go fuck yourself.
